repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Outdoor Advertising Association of America. Nancy Fletcher papers
did.abstract: Founded in 1891, the Outdoor Advertising Association of America (OAAA, now the Out of Home Advertising Association of America) is one of the oldest and largest advertising industry trade organizations in North America. It is headquartered in Washington, D.C. Nancy Fletcher is a lawyer and advertising executive who served as President and CEO of OAAA from 1991-2019. The Nancy Fletcher papers include clippings, correspondence, meeting minutes, newsletters, planning documentation, texts of speeches and presentations and other materials. Topics include highway beautification and other legislation, relations with government regulators, state issues and the transition of the organization to more broadly represent the out of home advertising industry. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History and the Kevin P. Reilly Sr. Outdoor Advertising Archives.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: General Files; Outdoor Advertising Campaigns; OAAA Administrative Files; Research Reports; Speeches and Presentations.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1891, the Outdoor Advertising Association of America (OAAA, now the Out of Home Advertising Association of America) is one of the oldest and largest advertising industry trade organizations in North America. It is headquartered in Washington, D.C. Nancy Fletcher is a lawyer and advertising executive who served as President and CEO of OAAA from 1991-2019.

Nancy Fletcher attended the University of North Dakota and the University of Minnesota (BA, History 1975; MBA 1978) and the Mitchell Hamline School of Law (JD 1981). She worked as an lobbyist for Larkin Hoffman (1975-1978) before joining Naegele Outdoor, Twin Cities, where she held positions of General Counsel, President and General Manager between 1978 and 1991. In 1991 Fletcher was elected President and CEO of OAAA and served from 1991 until her retirement in 2019. She also served as Interim President of Geopath from 2014-2015. Fletcher received a Lifetime Achievement Award from the global out-of-home organization FEPE (now the World Out of Home Organization/WOO) in 2016 and in 2020 was elected to the Board of Directors of Lamar Advertising.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access note. Collection contains fragile audiovisual/photographic formats that may need to be reformatted before use. Contact Research Services for access.
Access restricted. Portions of the collection closed by donor request until 2029.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Outdoor Advertising Association of America. Nancy Fletcher papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Outdoor Advertising Association of America. Nancy Fletcher papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Ashton Merck and Richard Collier, Oct. 2020;
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2019-0139.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
God Speaks public service advertising campaign records;
Outdoor Advertising Association of America archives.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Nancy Fletcher papers include clippings, correspondence, meeting minutes, newsletters, planning documentation, texts of speeches and presentations and other materials. Topics include highway beautification and other legislation, relations with government regulators, state issues and the transition of the organization to more broadly represent the out of home advertising industry.
